pros: Some flexibility with work schedules

review_title: Probably not the best option out there
job_title: CERTIFIED PEER SPECIALIST in Leominster, MA
pros: A great community of folks who care about making clients lives better.
cons: Pay is terrible, hr blames it on the union and union blames hr. Nobody seems happy and there’s no way to speak to management beyond your direct supervisor.

review_title: Run as fast as you can!
pros: There are some decent workers but otherwise nothing. The CEO (no longer Nicole Gagne, but Tamara Lundi) is a sham, has 0 experience, and has essentially run the place into the ground.
cons: See Pros... that should say it all.

pros: The populations we served, the people we helped- very rewarding.
cons: As a manager your work 24/7 for almost nothing....No work/life balance

pros: Mission. Providing needed services in community.
cons: Leadership is disconnected from front-line managers and staff, decisions are divorced from what the situation actually is on the ground,  leading to frustration and turnover

pros: Lots of mon-the-job training, great benefits, ample time off
cons: Unprofessional employees (not a very 'theraputic' atmosphere in detox) probably because pay is VERY low and turnover is VERY high. Management doesn't seem to care about improving workplace.

pros: Supportive VP, great teamwork, mission driven, work life balance, patient centered, great benefits . Agency is driven to improve outcomes for patients and staff in the community and recognize what is needed to get there by including feedback from all staff and stakeholders
cons: Low pay for staff resulting in short staffing resulting In inability to hire staff or provide care.

review_title: Do not work here in a management capacity.
pros: The people I worked around were extremely nice, I'm really not sure why they do this to themselves. Non-management clinicians are union so they have a significantly different experience. Easy to move up due to extremely high turnover.
cons: Are you a social services clinician with several years of experience trying to work your way up the administration ladder? Think you've found a great opportunity? I did too when they found me. Run from this place. They chewed me up and spit me out. For a place associated with the largest hospital/university in Massachusetts, this organization is shockingly dysfunctional. They only pay you for 37.5 hours as a manager but you work 50 AT A MINIMUM, the work life balance was nonexistent and you (and every other manager) will regularly send work emails and take phone calls at 9-10pm (or later!). Almost every program is wildly understaffed to the point where managers are covering 3-4 positions on their own, and if they don't figure out something they're going to lose programs and funding quite soon. The market for LICSWs/LMHCs is booming in Massachusetts right now, find somewhere that actually appreciates their skilled workforce. You've worked hard to get to this point, don't do this to yourself. Please.

pros: Nice clinicians for the most part
cons:
Management will leave you out to dry as fast as they can
Turn over is incredibly high
Pay is incredibly low

staff is constantly under minded

job_title: CERTIFIED PEER SPECIALIST in Worcester, MA
pros: Flexible schedule, Terrific boss, great immediate co-workers,
cons: Employees especially management don't adhere to the mission of the company, and the team doesn't act as a team, in meetings discussion of real problem, there is no answer.

pros: You learn a lot very quickly. Great place to start out a career. Good time off schedule.
cons: Little to no training; executive management does not think about decisions and how they affect the rest of the staff. Being in middle management you get the brunt of the work and very poor pay. They use the excuse “no one works here to make money” way too often. They also make so many changes too quickly.

pros: very rewarding, ability to really make a difference helping people, good time off.
cons: terrible pay, almost insulting :( for the level of stress and demands related to doing the the job correctly and wholehearted

pros: Strong union, PTO, decent management in my department
cons: Heavy Workload due to low-staffing on some shifts

review_title: Pay it forward. Be an example.
job_title: School Based Clinician in Leominster, MA
pros: Very supportive colleagues and supervisors are knowledgeable and helpful in reviewing clinical cases. There is a lot of passion for helping kids and families.  Plenty work in the schools.
cons: Very little room for advancement. No full time positions.  It seems that CHL only offers FFS school based positions and full time positions are no longer available.

job_title: Case Manager, Residential Counselor in Worcester, MA
pros: Union for non-management employees, always open positions so room to transfer, always overtime available
cons: Lack of supplies necessary for program functions, poorly trained and poorly screened employees, substandard industry pay and benefits, run by people who clearly only care about the bottom line. No desire to foster relationships with employees. Management is overworked, underpaid, and, in many cases, undertrained/educated--poor leadership led to at least one client death while I worked there.

job_title: Assistant Program Coordinator in Worcester, MA
pros: Good care for staff, there are flexibility in job functions, staff are given numerous of way to  have there issue address.
cons: There is not enough means for staff to improve. Staff does not have enough means to address how to improve one career.

job_title: Mental Health Clinician in Worcester, MA
pros: Some of the staff are very supportive
cons: Management fires a fair amount of people and enforces policies inconsistently. They give great reviews then will throw you under the bus.

pros: It's hard to think of anything positive about working here except for my coworkers.  They were the only ones keeping me sane.
cons: Training was non-existent.  They just threw you into the mix.  Every good manager I had left.  There was no support.  Caseloads became dangerously high, but they kept piling them on to make more money for the program.  The benefits were dismal.

pros: Good vacation time Monday through Friday work week
cons:
Lack of support for RN staff, no DON for staff to consult
Much more support for clinicians

review_title: RUN AND NEVER LOOK BACK EVER
pros: Services to the homeless, mentally ill individuals and those with substance abuse problems.
cons: Where in the world did the upper management staff of this company train or go to school?

review_title: Worst human service agency in Massachusetts
pros: Experience with high risk and challenging clients. You will definitely be exposed to the tough situations and be challenged.  Clients are the most vulnerable and difficult to treat.
cons: Terrible pay, no room for growth as highest paid are managers who have been there too long who are not competent, union environment. Residential dept is a mess. Lack of effective leadership at the top.

pros: Committed to diversity, equality and progressive standards.
cons: Very expansive, which is excellent overall, but working in a small program may cause you to forget that it is part of Community Healthlink.
